technicalEvents.title: Hackathon 2025
technicalEvents.name: Code Warriors
technicalEvents.description: A 24-hour coding marathon where teams compete to build innovative solutions to real-world problems. Showcase your coding skills and creativity in this intense competition.
rules: All code must be written during the event
Use of open-source libraries is permitted
Final projects must be submitted by the deadline
Judging based on innovation, functionality, and presentation

technicalEvents.title: Web Development Challenge
technicalEvents.name: WebWizards
technicalEvents.description: Design and develop a fully functional website based on the given theme within the time limit. Show off your front-end and back-end skills.
rules: Judging based on design, functionality, and code quality

technicalEvents.title: AI/ML Workshop & Competition
technicalEvents.name: Neural Nexus
technicalEvents.description: Learn about the latest advancements in AI and machine learning, then apply your knowledge in a competition to solve real-world problems using AI techniques.
rules: Workshop attendance is mandatory for competition participation
Solutions must be original and ethical
Judging based on accuracy, innovation, and practical application

technicalIndividualEvents.title: Coding Competition
technicalIndividualEvents.name: CodeNinja
technicalIndividualEvents.description: Test your programming skills in this fast-paced coding competition. Solve algorithmic problems and optimize your solutions for efficiency.
rules: Languages allowed: C, C++, Java, Python
Internet access not allowed during competition
Judging based on correctness, efficiency, and time taken

technicalIndividualEvents.title: UI/UX Design Challenge
technicalIndividualEvents.name: DesignMasters
technicalIndividualEvents.description: Create stunning user interfaces and experiences for the given problem statement. Showcase your design thinking and creativity.
rules: Judging based on creativity, usability, and presentation

technicalIndividualEvents.title: Cybersecurity Challenge
technicalIndividualEvents.name: HackShield
technicalIndividualEvents.description: Put your cybersecurity skills to the test in this CTF-style competition. Identify vulnerabilities, crack codes, and secure systems against attacks.
rules: No actual hacking of university systems allowed
Judging based on number of challenges solved and time taken

nonTechnicalEvents.title: Cultural Night
nonTechnicalEvents.name: Rhythms
nonTechnicalEvents.description: A celebration of diverse cultures through music, dance, and performances. Showcase your talents and enjoy a night of entertainment.
rules: Maximum time limit: 10 minutes per performance
Judging based on creativity, skill, and audience engagement

nonTechnicalEvents.title: Debate Competition
nonTechnicalEvents.name: VoiceBox
nonTechnicalEvents.description: Express your views and opinions on contemporary topics. Develop your public speaking and critical thinking skills.
rules: Topics will be announced 1 hour before the event
Each team gets 5 minutes for presentation and 2 minutes for rebuttal
Judging based on content, delivery, and rebuttals

nonTechnicalEvents.title: Photography Contest
nonTechnicalEvents.name: FrameIt
nonTechnicalEvents.description: Capture moments and tell stories through your lens. Submit your best photographs based on the theme and compete for recognition.
rules: Theme will be announced one week before submission deadline
Basic editing allowed, but no major manipulations
Judging based on creativity, composition, and theme relevance
